mainBoard.flavorText:
"I am reminded of the fable of the silver egg. Its owner cracks it open to see what jewels it holds, only to discover a simple yellow yolk."
—Karn, silver golem
mainBoard.name: Bottle Gnomes
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.

mainBoard.name: Phyrexian Negator

rulings.text: Sacrificing this card does not prevent you from having to make the other sacrifices.

mainBoard.text:
Trample
Whenever Phyrexian Negator is dealt damage, sacrifice that many permanents.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"The final stage of the illness: delirium, convulsions, and death."
—Phyrexian progress notes
mainBoard.name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
mainBoard.text:
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Plaguelord: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"For all the priceless tomes they have destroyed, one would think they would taste better."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath
mainBoard.name: Ravenous Rats
mainBoard.text: When Ravenous Rats enters, target opponent discards a card.

mainBoard.name: Ticking Gnomes
mainBoard.text:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice Ticking Gnomes: It deals 1 damage to any target.

mainBoard.name: Cursed Scroll

rulings.text: If you have no cards in hand, you still have to name a card. Then you fail to reveal one (since there aren’t any). Since the named card wasn’t revealed, no damage is dealt.

mainBoard.text: {3}, {T}: Choose a card name, then reveal a card at random from your hand. If that card has the chosen name, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to any target.

mainBoard.name: Powder Keg

rulings.text: Only destroys artifacts and creatures with exactly the specified cost. It does not mean “less than or equal to”.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can’t go back later even if it is something you usually do.

mainBoard.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Powder Keg.
{T}, Sacrifice Powder Keg: Destroy each artifact and creature with mana value equal to the number of fuse counters on Powder Keg.

mainBoard.name: Corpse Dance

rulings.text: Corpse Dance only exiles the card if the card is still on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step.
The effect only grants Haste until the end of the current turn. If the creature somehow manages to stick around until a later turn, it will no longer have Haste.

mainBoard.text:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return the top creature card of your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"From void evolved Phyrexia. Great Yawgmoth, Father of Machines, saw its perfection. Thus The Grand Evolution began."
—*Phyrexian Scriptures*
mainBoard.name: Dark Ritual
mainBoard.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.

mainBoard.flavorText: Greven *il*-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."
mainBoard.name: Diabolic Edict
mainBoard.text: Target player sacrifices a creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: The grave robbers arrived the day after the burial. They were a day too late.
mainBoard.name: Rapid Decay

rulings.text: You pick the cards during announcement. If any are not there on resolution, any others that are there are still affected.

mainBoard.text:
Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer
mainBoard.name: Vampiric Tutor

rulings.text: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle and put that card on top. You lose 2 life.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"We decide who is worthy of our works."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor
mainBoard.name: Duress
mainBoard.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

mainBoard.flavorText:
There are medicines for all afflictions but idleness.
—Suq'Ata saying
mainBoard.name: Stupor
mainBoard.text: Target opponent discards a card at random, then discards a card.

mainBoard.name: Yawgmoth's Will

rulings.text: If an effect asks you to discard a card, you can’t “discard” something that is in your graveyard. Those cards are not in your hand. Thus, Cycling abilities of cards in the graveyard can’t be activated.
If you cast a Buyback spell, then there will be two effects trying to replace where the card goes. You get to choose if the Buyback returns the card to your hand or the card gets exiled.
If you play a card using Yawgmoth’s Will and something triggers only when “cast from your hand”, that something will not trigger. Such things trigger based on where the card came from.
It will exile itself since it goes to the graveyard after its effect starts.
The second ability creates a replacement effect. It applies to both costs and effects.
To “play a card” is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.
You cannot Suspend a card from your graveyard, only your hand.

mainBoard.text:
Until end of turn, you may play lands and cast spells from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

mainBoard.name: Spawning Pool

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it’s already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

mainBoard.text:
Spawning Pool enters tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
{1}{B}: Spawning Pool becomes a 1/1 black Skeleton creature with "{B}: Regenerate this creature" until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it regenerates, the next time it would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

mainBoard.flavorText: The seed of a world's evil.
mainBoard.name: Volrath's Stronghold
mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"The land promises nothing and keeps its promise."
—Oracle *en*-Vec
mainBoard.name: Wasteland
mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.

sideBoard.flavorText: It's all fun and games until someone loses an eye.
sideBoard.name: Carrion Beetles

rulings.text: If any of the targets are not there on resolution, the others are still affected.
You pick the 0, 1, 2, or 3 target cards on announcement.

sideBoard.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.

sideBoard.name: Evincar's Justice
sideBoard.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Evincar's Justice deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"I will flay the skin from your flesh and the flesh from your bones and scrape your bones dry. And still you will not have suffered enough."
—Greven *il*-Vec, to Gerrard
sideBoard.name: Hatred

rulings.text: The life payment is part of the cost to cast Hatred, so it is lost if this spell is countered.

sideBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle *en*-Vec
sideBoard.name: Perish
sideBoard.text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.

sideBoard.flavorText:
"My finest warrior was lost to the Phyrexians. I pray that Lady Selenia died honorably."
—Radiant, archangel
sideBoard.name: Persecute

rulings.text: The color is chosen on resolution.

sideBoard.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.

rulings.text: It affects all players, including you.

sideBoard.flavorText: When the alliance between Balduvia and Kjeldor deprived Stromgald of easy victories, its agents were forced to fuel their rituals with their own flesh.
